intro: Neobartsia laticrenata, commonly known as the broad-crested bartsia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the rainy season. Neobartsia laticrenata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
